startScreenOptions.title: HIPAA Hotspot: Protect Patient Privacy
startScreenOptions.shortStartDescription: Spot and correct privacy risks in a Georgia dental practice.

params.intro: Select the statement that matches HIPAA best practice.

summary: Secure screens and paper records whenever you step away.
Visible monitors pose no privacy risk.
PHI can stay on a counter if staff are nearby.
Document suspected breaches using the AADA incident log.
Skip documentation unless the patient complains.
Keep PHI conversations out of public spaces.
Elevator chats are fine if voices are low.
Discuss cases openly to improve teamwork.

questions.question: PHI is visible on the monitor in the reception area. What do you do first?

answers.text: Turn or cover the monitor, secure PHI, and log the incident.
Wait until closing to clear the screen.
Leave it—patients see the schedule daily.

questions.question: A patient file is left on the front counter. How do you secure it?

answers.text: Move it to a locked cabinet and note corrective action.
Flip the folder over until someone remembers it.
Leave it; staff will grab it soon.

questions.question: You’re about to discuss treatment over the phone. What is the required safeguard?

answers.text: Use two patient identifiers before sharing PHI.
Share details if the caller sounds urgent.
Assume the caller is family and proceed.

params.question: Discussing a patient’s name in the elevator is acceptable when no one seems nearby.
params.correctText: Correct.  Public spaces are never appropriate for PHI conversations.
params.incorrectText: Review privacy zones—keep PHI out of shared areas.

l10n.requiresCompletionWarning: You need to answer all the questions correctly before continuing.
l10n.endcardInformation: You have answered @answered questions, click below to submit your answers.
l10n.endcardInformationNoAnswers: You have not answered any questions.
l10n.endcardInformationMustHaveAnswer: You have to answer at least one question before you can submit your answers.
l10n.endCardTableRowSummaryWithScore: You got @score out of @total points for the @question that appeared after @minutes minutes and @seconds seconds.
l10n.endCardTableRowSummaryWithoutScore: You have answered the @question that appeared after @minutes minutes and @seconds seconds.
